core

Class VFSApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.VFSApp

  • public class VFSApp
extends java.lang.Object
    A virtual file system application that can be included in a user interface.
    Author:
    omar

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VFSApp()
      creates a VFSApp loading all existing virtual file systems on the working directory in the host file system.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      returns the prompt string in the following format: "(time) (working virtual file system) :/(working directory)/ "

      sets the current working virtual file system and returns the prompt string in the following format: "(time) (working virtual file system) :/(working directory)/ "

      returns the virtual file system with the given name

      • getVFSByName

        public VirtualFileSystem getVFSByName(java.lang.String vfsName)
        returns the virtual file system with the given name
        Parameters:
        vfsName - name of the virtual file system to look for
        Returns:
        a reference to the VirtualFileSystem if found
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual disk found

        Returns:
        workingVFS reference.

      • list

        public java.lang.String list(java.lang.String vfsName,
                             java.lang.String args,
                             java.lang.String pathName)
        returns a string where it lists all the content of a directory on a virtual file system. It is similar to the "ls" command on Unix systems.
        Parameters:
        vfsName - virtual file system name
        args - arguments of the command
        pathName - the path name of the directory to show all its content
        Returns:
        a string where all the content of the directory is listed
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchDirectoryException - if the path name is not valid
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument

      • changeDir

        public void changeDir(java.lang.String vfsName,
                      java.lang.String pathName)
        changes the current working directory of a virtual file system. It is similar to the "cd" command on Unix systems.
        Parameters:
        vfsName - virtual file system name
        pathName - the path name of the directory where to go
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchDirectoryException - if the path name is not valid
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument

      • makeDir

        public void makeDir(java.lang.String vfsName,
                    java.lang.String pathName)
        creates a new directory in a virtual file system. It is similar to the "mkdir" command on Unix systems.
        Parameters:
        vfsName - virtual file system name
        pathName - the path name of the directory to create
        Throws:
        exceptions.NameAlreadyExistsException - if there's a VNode with the name of the new directory
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument

      • makeFile

        public void makeFile(java.lang.String vfsName,
                     java.lang.String pathName,
                     java.lang.String dim)
        creates a new file in a virtual file system. It is similar to the "touch" command on Unix systems.
        Parameters:
        vfsName - virtual file system name
        pathName - the path name of the file to create
        dim - the size (in bytes) of the file
        Throws:
        exceptions.NameAlreadyExistsException - if there's a VNode with the name of the new directory
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument

      • move

        public void move(java.lang.String vfsName,
                 java.lang.String oldPathName,
                 java.lang.String newPathName)
        moves/renames a VNode on a virtual file system. It is similar to the "mv" command on Unix systems.
        Parameters:
        vfsName - virtual file system name
        oldPathName - path name of the VNode to move/rename
        newPathName - new path name of the VNode to move/rename
        Throws:
        exceptions.NameAlreadyExistsException - if there's a VNode with the same name
        exceptions.NoSuchDirectoryException - if a path name is not valid
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if operation fails

      • moveAndOverwrite

        public void moveAndOverwrite(java.lang.String vfsName,
                             java.lang.String oldPathName,
                             java.lang.String newPathName)
        moves/renames a VNode on a virtual file system. If the file/directory already exists it overwrites it. It is similar to the "mv" command on Unix systems.
        Parameters:
        vfsName - virtual file system name
        oldPathName - path name of the VNode to move/rename
        newPathName - new path name of the VNode to move/rename
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchDirectoryException - if a path name is not valid
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if operation fails

      • copy

        public void copy(java.lang.String vfsName,
                 java.lang.String oldPathName,
                 java.lang.String newPathName)
        copies a VNode on a virtual file system. It is similar to the "cp" command on Unix systems.
        Parameters:
        vfsName - virtual file system name
        oldPathName - path name of the VNode to copy
        newPathName - new path name of the directory where to copy
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchDirectoryException - if a path name is not valid
        exceptions.NameAlreadyExistsException - if there's a VNode with the same name
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if operation fails
        exceptions.NoFreeSpaceLeftException - if the virtual file system does not have enough space left

      • copyAndOverwrite

        public void copyAndOverwrite(java.lang.String vfsName,
                             java.lang.String oldPathName,
                             java.lang.String newPathName)
        copies a VNode on a virtual file system. If the VNode already exists it overwrites it. It is similar to the "cp" command on Unix systems.
        Parameters:
        vfsName - virtual file system name
        oldPathName - path name of the VNode to copy
        newPathName - new path name of the directory where to copy
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchDirectoryException - if a path name is not valid
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if operation fails
        exceptions.NoFreeSpaceLeftException - if the virtual file system does not have enough space left

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String vfsName,
                   java.lang.String pathName)
        removes a VNode from a virtual file system. It is similar to the "rm" command on Unix systems.
        Parameters:
        vfsName - virtual file system name
        pathName - path name of the VNode to remove
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchFileOrDirectoryException - if pathName is not valid
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if operation fails

      • createVFS

        public void createVFS(java.lang.String vfsName,
                      long dim)
        creates a new virtual file system of the a given dimension
        Parameters:
        vfsName - name of the virtual file system to create
        dim - a long value representing the dimension (in bytes) of the new virtual file system
        Throws:
        exceptions.SizeNotAllowedException - if space dimension is too big
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if formatting operation fails
        See Also:
        VirtualFileSystem

      • removeVFS

        public void removeVFS(java.lang.String vfsName)
        deletes a virtual file system
        Parameters:
        vfsName - name of the virtual file system to delete
        Throws:
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if operation fails
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument
        See Also:
        VirtualFileSystem

      • formatVFS

        public void formatVFS(java.lang.String vfsName)
        formats a virtual file system
        Parameters:
        vfsName - name of the virtual file system to format
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if operation fails
        See Also:
        VirtualFileSystem

      • importToVFS

        public void importToVFS(java.lang.String hostPathName,
                        java.lang.String vfsName,
                        java.lang.String pathName)
        imports a file/directory from the host file system to a virtual file system
        Parameters:
        hostPathName - path name of the file/directory to import from the host file system
        vfsName - virtual file system where to import
        pathName - path name of the directory where to import on the virtual file system
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoFreeSpaceLeftException - if the virtual file system does not have enough space left
        exceptions.NameAlreadyExistsException - if there's a VNode with the same name
        exceptions.NoSuchDirectoryException - if the path name is not valid
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if operation fails
        See Also:
        VirtualFileSystem

      • exportVFS

        public void exportVFS(java.lang.String vfsName,
                      java.lang.String pathName)
        exports a virtual file system to the host file system
        Parameters:
        vfsName - the name of the virtual file system to export
        pathName - path name on the host file system of the directory where to export
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument
        exceptions.VFSOperationFailException - if operation fails
        See Also:
        VNode

      • free

        public java.lang.String free(java.lang.String vfsName)
        returns a string showing the free/occupied space of a virtual file system
        Parameters:
        vfsName - name of the virtual file system
        Returns:
        toString() value of the virtual file system object
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument
        See Also:
        VirtualFileSystem

      • tree

        public java.lang.String tree(java.lang.String vfsName)
        returns a String containing all the content of a virtual file system formatted in a tree structure.
        Parameters:
        vfsName - the name of the virtual file system
        Returns:
        getTree() value of the virtual file system object
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument
        See Also:
        VirtualFileSystem

      • find

        public java.lang.String find(java.lang.String vfsName,
                             java.lang.String fileName)
        finds all files with a given name in a virtual file system
        Parameters:
        vfsName - name of the virtual file system
        fileName - file's name to look for
        Returns:
        a string containing all absolute path names of the files found
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument
        exceptions.NoSuchFileOrDirectoryException - if no file is found

      • getPrompt

        public java.lang.String getPrompt(java.lang.String vfsName)
        sets the current working virtual file system and returns the prompt string in the following format: "(time) (working virtual file system) :/(working directory)/ "
        Parameters:
        vfsName - name of the virtual file system
        Returns:
        the prompt string
        Throws:
        exceptions.NoSuchVirtualFileSystemException - if no virtual file system correspond to the given name argument

        public java.lang.String getPrompt()
        returns the prompt string in the following format: "(time) (working virtual file system) :/(working directory)/ "
